sm::eod::io::DatagramSocket

DatagramSocket Class Reference

#include <datagramsocket.h>

List of all members.

Detailed Description

This class represents a socket for sending and receiving UDP packets.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DatagramSocket ( int  port_num = 0,
int  rcv_buff_len = 4096,
int  send_buff_len = 4096 
) [explicit]

Constructs a datagram socket and binds it to the specified port on the local host machine.

Parameters:
port_num The port number to bind to. Ports below 1024 usually require special privileges to create. The default value of 0 chooses an unused port.
rcv_buff_len The maximum size UDP packet that can be recieved.
send_buff_len The maximum size UDP packet that can be sent.

DatagramSocket ( std::vector< std::string >  multicast,
int  port_num 
) [explicit]

multicast ip address on the specified port.

Closes the socket.

bool connected (  )  const

Definition at line 121 of file datagramsocket.h.

void connectSocket ( const InetAddress &  address  ) 

Connects the socket to the remote address.

Connecting the DatagramSocket to a specific address ensures that the socket can only send to or receive from that address.

Note:
Since these are UDP sockets, there is no "connection" made with any other process on any other host, so connected here means just connecting to an address (UDP port on a host).

bool dataReady (  )  const

Returns:
true if data is waiting in receive buffer

int receiveDatagram ( std::vector< uint8 > &  buffer,
const InetAddress &  from,
int  timeout_ms = 100,
const bool  append_buffer = false 
) const

Receives a datagram packet for this socket.

Note: this method blocks the calling thread. Use the dataReady method to do a non-blocking check for data.

Parameters:
buffer Receives data in the datagram
from Address data is to be received from
timeout_ms Time to wait for the data. After this period if data is not available this method returns 0
append_buffer If true, data is appended to the buffer, otherwise the data overwrites
Returns:
The number of bytes read or 0 if no data was available.
Exceptions:
SocketError operating system reported an error.

void sendDatagram ( const std::vector< uint8 > &  buffer,
const InetAddress &  to 
) const

Explicit send: sends to the address specified.

Warning: If the socket has already been connected to an address using connectSocket, the address argument will be ignored and the datagram will be sent to the connected address instead. If buffer is larger than getSendBufferSize() then multiple datagrams will be sent of send buffer size with a final datagram with the remainder. This behaviour should not be relied on as it may change in the future.

void sendDatagram ( const std::vector< uint8 > &  buffer  )  const

Sends a datagram packet from this socket.

If you have connected the socket to a remote address using connect(), then you can call Send without an address. If buffer is larger than getSendBufferSize() then multiple datagrams will be sent of send buffer size with a final datagram with the remainder. This behaviour should not be relied on as it may change in the future.

Parameters:
buffer the buffer of data to send.
Precondition:
buffer.size() <= max datagram size of 64KB
Exceptions:
SocketError if buffer.size() > 64KB, socket not connected or network failure.

void setReceiveBufferSize ( int  size  ) 

Sets the SO_RCVBUF option to the specified value for this DatagramSocket.

Parameters:
size The maximum size UDP packet that can be recieved. Datagrams larger than this value will be dropped.

void setSendBufferSize ( int  size  ) 

Sets the SO_SENDBUF option to the specified value for this DatagramSocket.

Parameters:
size The maximum size UDP packet that can be sent.
